intro: Carallia scortechinii, commonly known as the golden star hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-centered flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are ovate with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. Carallia scortechinii thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
